job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Plymouth, MA
pros: It was a small Hospital so I knew everyone in a good way! Always had help
cons: We were a small Hospital so sometimes we were short staffed

pros: Coworkers are fabulous, there isn't a nurse there I wouldn't trust with my life (provided I could circumvent the emergency room). Can't complain about the paycheck.
cons: Horrible nurse to patient ratios, no support, no CNAs, daily demands exceed what is humanly possible, administration doesn't give a fig about patients or staff, union is useless, shall I continue? 20+ years at this institution, no amount of money is worth this kind of stress (or liability).

pros: supportive work environment. flexible work from home schedule
cons: office moving to Sommerville to a shared service center

job_title: Food Service Aide in Plymouth, MA
pros:
- Good pay with nighttime differentials ($2.25/hr M-F; $3.90/hr Sa-Su). 
- Lenient management.
- Accepting coworkers. 
- Flexible Hours
cons:
- Dated facilities. 
- No pension. 
- No online scheduling system. 
- No website to view payroll or change payment methods. 
- Healthcare staff can be condescending or otherwise rude to kitchen staff, but this is uncommon.
- Shifts can be hard to come by if working per diem

pros: Good coworkers and management. Good docs
cons: Small ER with a lot of behavioral

job_title: Physician Assistant, PA-C in Plymouth, MA
pros: Pay and time off is decent.
cons: There is no inpatient acute pain service.

pros: Friendly staff, good shift differentials, bonuses offered, always hours to pick up, adequate resources, accepts new grads, new grad residency program is 1 year long and offers a lot of support, if you can be a nurse here you can be a nurse anywhere
cons: No set patient ratios, ER cannot divert ambulances, high patient volumes with inadequate staffing

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Plymouth, MA
pros:
Coworkers are mostly great
Flexible scheduling
cons:
Culture is poor, unit morale is not great 
Currently MNA bargaining and constant emails blaming staff for poor hiring. When indeed we refer people to apply and they never get a call back.

pros: Part of the hospital so good benfits
cons: The office is very disorganized

review_title: Public Safety was normally understaffed — and it was considered acceptable
job_title: Public Safety Officer in Plymouth, MA
pros: Mid level management and below were the best individuals to work with. The healthcare workers on the frontline held a majority positive attitude and were always friendly and kind.
cons: Public safety was always understaffed which lead to the inability to properly follow or improve on existing requirements and policy

job_title: Clinical Nurse Educator in Boston, MA
pros: Good benefits, strong union presence
cons: Sometimes the staff feels that they are easily replaced

pros: competitive pay and nice location
cons: outgrowing its size, not well staffed

review_title: NEEDHAM SENIOR LEADER = DEFINITION OF UNPROFESSIONAL!!!
pros: I only worked there for a short time and moved on to a much better position in an organization that values their employees on many levels.
cons:
Chief Financial Officer/Support Services Officer
Chief Nursing Officer/Chief Operating Officer
Various other "leadership" figures at the organization
Unorganized, untrustworthy, no empathy, no patience, close-minded, etc. etc.

review_title: Overall, a good learning experience at a small community hospital.
pros: Co-workers on certain shifts were very helpful and worked as a team. Union hospital with great representatives.
cons: The name of the hospital does not mean we are in any way similar to the Boston hospital. Management was always changing; 3 different managers on one floor in two and a half years. Small community hospital so there is not a lot of opportunities to see trauma or anything major.

job_title: Emergency Department Technician in Needham, MA
pros: BID Needham is small enough where it is very easy to become familiar with the staff who work there. It creates a family-like dynamic and can be very comforting compared to working in a larger city hospital. The hospital has also made many updates and renovations to some of their facilities, including the Emergency Department and Cancer Center. Current projects are underway to further expand the hospital.
cons: The pay is less than one would get in Boston. Given that BID Needham is a community hospital, it lacks many of the resources available in larger hospitals and therefore can only accommodate certain patient diagnoses.

pros: Coworkers were nice people but that's it.
cons: Unorganized and managers are a bunch of cheapskates. Nurses are always understaffed which compromises patient care. Always running out of medications because management is too cheap to buy enough. Pay is terrible compared to other hospitals. Food is gross. Management is constantly changing protocols and procedures without any thought to workflow. Bad. So bad.

review_title: The Pay Will Keep You There
pros:
Nice coworkers
Great pay
Always hours to pick up
cons:
Supervisors are hard to get along with
Very chaotic at times
They won't train you in other places unless you ask

job_title: Clinical Exercise Physiologist in Plymouth, MA
pros: I enjoy working with the patients in the community
cons: Management does no communicate with co workers at all.

review_title: Slow paced work and constantly working out of scope of position.
job_title: Public Safety Officer in Plymouth, MA
pros: Pay comparable to other hospitals as you work in house not for a contract agency, generous uniform allowance allows for enough to get you through the week.
cons: Only non union department of hospital. You feel disposable and never see manager, high benefit cost, being asked to do things that are definitely nowhere near your scope of duties.

pros: Good pay, hours to pick up, decent opportunities.
cons: Management needs improvement. Somewhat hard to move up in your department.

pros: Great benefits, good management in Needham
cons: slightly low salary, low room for growth

job_title: STaff Registered Nurse in Plymouth, MA
pros: Great coworkers putting up with poor management.
cons: No respect for workers needing a set schedule. Vacation not granted for entire unit for months on end. Management treats you like a warm body to fix staffing needs.

job_title: Administrative Secretary in Hyde Park, MA
pros: I love working with people and giving back to our community.
cons: It was a temporary assignment.

job_title: Medical Assistant in New York, NY
pros: Everyone really cares about the patients
cons: Not enough nurses and psychologist

pros: Good incentive for bonus shifts
cons: Unorganized and training system. Preceptors untrained

pros: Night shift $6 differential ,nice nursing staff
cons: Understaffed constantly low base pay

pros: A prestigious hospital, great benefits
cons: No parking, it is a temporary position
